bug.author: aliabbasjp
bug.summary: Windows : gcc.exe: error: spacy/parts_of_speech.cpp: No such file or directory
bug.description:
on doing a pip install -U spacy I get following error: <denchmark-code> C:\Users\TEST\Anaconda2\Scripts\gcc.bat -DMS_WIN64 -mdll -O -Wall -Ic:\u sers\TEST\anaconda2\include -Ic:\users\TEST\appdata\local\temp\pip-build -v5ebe1\spacy\include -Ic:\users\TEST\appdata\local\temp\pip-build-v5ebe1\sp acy\include\msvc9 -Ic:\users\TEST\anaconda2\include -Ic:\users\TEST\anac onda2\PC -c spacy/parts_of_speech.cpp -o build\temp.win-amd64-2.7\Release\spacy\ parts_of_speech.o -O3 -Wno-strict-prototypes -Wno-unused-function gcc.exe: error: spacy/parts_of_speech.cpp: No such file or directory gcc.exe: fatal error: no input files compilation terminated. error: command 'C:\\Users\\TEST\\Anaconda2\\Scripts\\gcc.bat' failed wit h exit status 1
---------------------------------------- Rolling back uninstall of spacy Command "c:\users\aliabbas\anaconda2\python.exe -u -c "import setuptools, tokeni ze;__file__='c:\\users\\aliabbas\\appdata\\local\\temp\\pip-build-v5ebe1\\spacy\ \setup.py';exec(compile(getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__).read().replace ('\r\n', '\n'), __file__, 'exec'))" install --record c:\users\aliabbas\appdata\l ocal\temp\pip-_mft0o-record\install-record.txt --single-version-externally-manag ed --compile" failed with error code 1 in c:\users\aliabbas\appdata\local\temp\p ip-build-v5ebe1\spacy\ </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Windows 8.1 64bit Python Version Used: Python 2.7.12 |Anaconda 2.5.0 (64-bit)| (default, Jun 29 2016, 11:07:13) [MSC v. 1500 64 bit (AMD64)] on win32

comments.comment: I was hacking on master and broke the build :(. Sorry folks.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/honnibal>@honnibal</denchmark-link>
Hi, is this issue resolved? I just tried pip install -U spacy today on Windows 10, Python 2.7, Anaconda and got the same issue. If not, is there an older version of spacy that can still be installed? Thanks!

Hi, This error message is displayed on most types of compilation failures, so it's not a clean symptom. I think there are current compilation problems on Windows, due to compiler versioning. I think <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/741>#741</denchmark-link> is the best active issue on this. A good start is to try installing from source, so we can look at a proper log. If you have time to debug this, updating <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/741>#741</denchmark-link> would be appreciated. If you need to just get started, you should find the most recent version for which binary wheels are available.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/honnibal>@honnibal</denchmark-link>
I have updated 741 with my recent attempt from source, hope it helps. In the meantime, do you know where I can find the binary wheels?
Anyone able to fix this error ? Pls post the solution to this.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
